metadata.title: CVE-2017-5024 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
FFmpeg in Google Chrome prior to 56.0.2924.76 for Linux, Windows and Mac,failed to perform proper bounds checking, which allowed a remote attackerto potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted video file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5024` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-browser-l10n - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-chromedriver - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.20.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0.2924.76-0ubuntu0.16.04.1268').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.20.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
ffmpeg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
